Activity: Finalize the presentation summarizing the proposed database schema design. Double-check all diagrams and specifications for accuracy.
Present the proposed database schema design to @itpm-1 and @clinlead-1. Clearly explain the rationale behind the design choices and address any concerns they may have.
Based on feedback from @itpm-1 and @clinlead-1, revise the database schema diagram and table specifications as needed. Document all changes.
If significant changes are required, schedule a follow-up meeting with @da-1, @da-2 to ensure the updated design still meets their reporting needs.

Assuming the database schema design is approved, begin creating the DDL (Data Definition Language) scripts for the new tables and table extensions. Ensure the scripts are well-formatted and include comments for clarity.
Review the DDL scripts with another DBA or senior developer to ensure they are syntactically correct and follow best practices.
Update the database schema documentation with the final approved design and the DDL scripts.
Plan for tomorrow: begin setting up a test environment to validate the new database schema. Prepare test data for the new tables.
